intro: Sticherus × leonis, commonly known as the hybrid sticherus, is a rare and intriguing member of the Apiaceae family. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Sticherus luteus and Sticherus leonis, exhibiting a combination of traits from both parent species. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and fern-like, while its small, white flowers appear in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Due to its rarity and unique characteristics, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
